job_description:
Associate Data Scientist/Software Developer

Caltech

Job Category: Fulltime Regular
Exempt Overtime Eligible: Exempt
Benefits Eligible: Benefit Based


Caltech is a world-renowned science and engineering institute that marshals some of the world's brightest minds and most innovative tools to address fundamental scientific questions. We thrive on finding and cultivating talented people who are passionate about what they do. Join us and be a part of the diverse Caltech community.

Job Summary

The Caltech Seismo Lab seeks an Associate Data Scientist/Software Developer to lead optimization of existing data processing applications, and implement real-time earthquake data processing in AWS serverless architecture. The successful candidate will be designing a new framework that will ingest real-time data into AWS from more than 600 sensor sites, process it with machine learning algorithms, and distribute products to both the public and scientific users. The successful candidate will also lead implementation and application of modern analytics in the new framework using the latest AWS technologies.

Job Duties

Learn fundamentals behind existing in-house earthquake data processing software.Lead development of a software framework specification document.Lead implementation of software and apply analytics in collaboration with faculty and postdocs.Interface with external colleagues on algorithmic and implementation issues.Be in charge of developing user documentation and associated analytics tools.Explore, architect, and apply different approaches to user interfaces and visualization.Develop and deploy analytics tools for tracking system performance.Maintain tools and documentation as needed.Other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's in a STEM field with significant computation experience.Experience with building end-to-end modular Python architecture.Experience with AWS software tools, machine learning, and architecting AWS workflows.Experience working in Linux, artificial intelligence, and cloud computing.Experience with programming, including Python and databases.Excellent oral and written communication skills needed.Proven ability to work in a team of staff with a wide range of expertise is necessary.

Preferred Qualifications

Masters or higher degree in a STEM field.Experience with C and C++.Experience with earthquake data processing software.Experience with GPUs, particularly with CUDA.Experience with IP networking.Experience with SQL and noSQL databases.Experience with Jupyter-hub and its deployment.

Required Documents

Resume

To be considered for this position please visit our web site and apply on line at the following link: https://hr.caltech.edu/work/job_openings

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Posted by the FREE value-added recruitment advertising agency

A Bachelor’s Degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent experience1+ years of industry experienceExpertise in one or more functional programming languages (Python, R, etc.)Knowledge of SparkMLExperience using ML libraries, such as scikit-learn, caret, mlr, mllibKnowledge of SQLFamiliarity with using data visualization toolsExperience giving data presentationsAbility to travel to client locations to deliver professional services when needed

Excited by using massive amounts of data to develop Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL) models? Want to help the largest global enterprises derive business value through the adoption of Artificial Intelligence (AI)? Eager to learn from many different enterprises’ use cases of AWS ML and DL? Thrilled to be key part of Amazon, who has been investing in Machine Learning for decades, pioneering and shaping the world’s AI technology?

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we are helping large enterprises build ML and DL models on the AWS Cloud and developing a variety of AI solutions. We are applying predictive technology to large volumes of data and against a wide spectrum of problems. Our Professional Services organization works together with our AWS customers to address their business needs using AI.

AWS Professional Services is a unique consulting team. We pride ourselves on being customer obsessed and highly focused on the AI enablement of our customers. If you have experience with AI, including building ML or DL models, we’d like to have you join our team. You will get to work with an innovative company, with great teammates, and have a lot of fun helping our customers.

A successful candidate will be a person who enjoys diving deep into data, doing analysis, discovering root causes, and designing long-term solutions. It will be a person who likes to have fun, loves to learn, and wants to innovate in the world of AI. Major responsibilities include:
Understand the customer’s business requirements and guide them to a solution using our AWS AI Services, AWS AI Platforms, AWS AI Frameworks, and AWS AI EC2 Instances . Assist customers by working with a team to deliver AI/ML/DL projects from beginning to end, including understanding business requirements, developing architecture, aggregating data, exploring data, building & validating predictive models, and deploying completed models to deliver business impact to the organization.Use Deep Learning frameworks like MXNet, Caffe 2, Tensorflow, Theano, CNTK, and Keras to help our customers build DL models.Use SparkML and Amazon Machine Learning (AML) to help our customers build ML models.Use Lex to develop Conversational User Interface (CUI)Work with our Professional Services Big Data consultants to analyze, extract, normalize, and label relevant data.Work with our Professional Services DevOps consultants to help our customers operationalize models after they are built.Assist customers with identifying model drift and retraining models.

Associate Data Scientists produce innovative solutions driven by exploratory data analysis from complex and high-dimensional datasets. Apply knowledge of statistics, data modeling, and advanced mathematics to recognize patterns, identify opportunities, pose business questions, and make valuable discoveries. Use a flexible, analytical approach to design, develop, and evaluate predictive models. Generate and test hypotheses. The Associate Data Scientist proactively seeks to develop their skillsets and provide value-added support within the Data Science team.

Essential Functions

Support large projects, and manage smaller projects in their entiretyPartner with senior team members to assess customer needs and define business questions. job_description:
Background
Tulsa Innovation Labs LLC (TIL) is a tech-led economic and workforce development organization headquartered in Tulsa, OK, and pioneered by George Kaiser Family Foundation. This new venture will develop a strategic plan and deploy capital to catalyze economic growth in emerging tech industries. Through public-private-partnerships, the company will launch new startup, academic innovation, and talent programs to support Tulsa?s economic development.
For more information, visit: www.tulsainnovationlabs.com
Job Purpose
The new venture is looking for an associate to join the founding team and help lead its cyber and analytics portfolio. The role will concentrate on building and managing TIL?s cyber and analytics programs and projects, which will focus on workforce development and applied research.
Two programs sit under the cyber and analytics portfolio already: the TU-Team8 Cyber Fellows, a doctoral fellowship in computer science, focused on commercializing applied research and the Holberton School, a software engineering school. The associate will take the lead on developing a suite of new programs and projects in addition to managing, at a high-level, the two current programs.
The job will not involve subject matter expertise or technical duties, but rather focus on tech-led economic development, innovation ecosystem building, workforce development, and emerging tech more broadly. Working knowledge and interest in cyber and analytics is important for the role, however.
About Cyber
Cybersecurity is experiencing near exponential growth, with applications across industries. Although there are many mature cyber companies, there is still heavy innovation and growth happening in niche areas. Cybersecurity for Internet of Things (IoT) and operational technology (OT) security are two segments with especially high growth, high investment, and limited consolidation.
TIL?s plans to build Tulsa into a regional, then national leader in cyber. To do so, TIL is focusing on building an inclusive and high-quality cyber workforce and fostering applied research between local universities and industry partners.
About Analytics


Data and analytics is a rapidly-growing sector in almost every industry. Given it?s increasing importance, building capabilities in advanced analytics (e.g. Artificial intelligence, machine learning) can be a catalyst to improve Tulsa?s positioning in both its existing industries and in emerging sectors.
TIL?s vision is for Tulsa to be a leader in data analytics and data sciences education and training. Startups and established companies alike need analytics talent. By investing heavily in workforce development for advanced analytics, TIL will help fuel the growth of telemedicine, operational technology for energy, and drones.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
This role will focus on managing TIL?s cyber and analytics portfolio.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Research: research local, national, and global tech trends related to cyber and advanced analytics as well as best practices in economic development and innovation ecosystem building through primary and secondary sources
Analysis: analyze market, industry, and labor data, including stakeholder interviews, to identify actionable insights and make recommendations based on qualitative and quantitative data
Strategy: informed by rigorous research and data analysis, build a strategic plan for the company and for Tulsa?s innovation economy focused on cyber and analytics, including KPIs
Program Development: using data, build economic development programs tailored to Tulsa, complete with business models, partnership structures, desired outcomes, and timelines, focusing primarily on workforce and applied research programs targeted at growing the city?s cyber and analytics capabilities
Other duties as assigned

REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS
Education and Experience
Undergraduate degree required, with an excellent academic record (GPA: 3.5+)
Graduate degree preferred, particularly MBA, MPA, MPP, or master’s in urban planning
Experience in management consulting, venture capital, tech, applied research, urban planning, or workforce or economic development (internships acceptable for recent graduates)
Experience researching and analyzing innovation ecosystems and emerging tech fields
Experience designing and managing complex projects involving cross-sector stakeholders
Background in STEM education preferred
Background in cyber and/or advanced analytics preferred
Desired Skills and Abilities:
Quantitative and qualitative research and analytical skills and ability to make strategic insights
Written communication skills, including developing concise memos and PowerPoint decks
Oral communication skills, including public speaking and formal and informal presentations
Project management skills, including demonstrated ability to support complex projects against narrow timelines and various constraints, to prioritize among competing needs, and to manage multiple tasks with little supervision
Partnership building skills, including ability to engage stakeholders in a professional manner and build diverse coalitions
Ability to look at challenges strategically and formulate creative solutions
Demonstrated leader with an instinct for taking the initiative
Proven team player with an ability to work cross-functionally
Ability to balance having fun while getting top results at work
Other Skills and Requirements:
Proficient in MS Office Suite
Familiar with social media
Willingness to travel – this position will be based in Tulsa
Moderate travel nationally and internationally
Tulsa residency required shortly after starting
Must be able to frequently travel to sites independently across Tulsa
Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds
Application Requirements and Process:
Applications will be considered on a rolling basis
Submit a 1-page resume only

Associate Full Stack Developer

Location:
2800 E Spring Creek Pkwy, Spring Creek Campus
Plano, Texas, 75074
United States
We are searching for an experienced Associate Full Stack Developer

Why work at Collin College?
About Us
Collin College’s employees pride themselves on being part of an established, higher-education leader in Collin County and the surrounding area. The college is currently in a growth period, breaking ground on several new physical campuses, and launching new initiatives in the online education arena. In 2021, the college will have 11 sites throughout the county.
Independent surveys of the college’s employees show it is an amazing place to work. In 2019, Collin College was named one of the “Great Colleges to Work For” by the Great Colleges Program. Collin College has been recognized as one of the DFW Metroplex’s “Best and Brightest Companies to Work For” for four years in a row. Residents are a short drive from the larger DFW Metroplex, a vibrant metropolis bursting with culture, industry, innovation, and entertainment. There really is something for everyone here.
Culture
Should you choose to start your journey with us, you will find yourself immersed in a culture of innovation and growth. Initiatives tied to the college’s master and strategic plans challenge our employees to grow professionally while still feeling supported with training and collaboration.
Benefits
Beyond your day-to-day duties, you will also find amazing benefits offered by Collin, including, but not limited to:
Vacation Days – Rest and re-energize with 12 vacation days each year
Sick Days – The college offers 12 sick days accrued each year
Personal Days – Take time for yourself with three personal days (24 hours per fiscal year)
Paid Holidays – We offer up to 16 paid holidays each fiscal year
Medical – Choose one of two exceptional health plans (HealthSelect and Consumer Directed HealthSelect)
Dental – Keep your teeth sparkly white using the college’s dental plan (two plans available)
Wellness – We encourage an active lifestyle. Dedicate up to 1.5 hours of your work week towards wellness in our fitness centers
Teacher Retirement System – Savings for your retirement starts from day one via the TRS system
403b with 3% Match – Want to put even more away for your retirement? The college will match up to 3% of what you put in your 403b
Professional Development – Need to attend a conference or become certified to reach the next level in your career? We work with our employees to ensure they have access to professional development opportunities to succeed in their roles at Collin College
Job Purpose:
In a fast-paced team environment, collaboratively assist in the creation and development of web and software solutions for Collin College’s website, web and/or native mobile apps, and other application platforms. Provide novel solutions for improvement to existing processes and procedures. This role will provide hands-on focus through-out the project process from conception to production including connecting components to existing application program interfaces (APIs.)
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Assist with the evaluation and development of web or software solutions for Collin College’s website, web apps, and other application platforms.
Collaborate cross-functionally with other web and app development team members.
Maintain websites and implement any necessary additions or enhancements.
In conjunction with the full-stack developer, identify, troubleshoot and offer solutions to various website, web app, and native application issues, coding problems, and software and integration issues.
Participate in system architecture decision process.
Work with the front-end solutions team to ensure timely delivery of products.
Participate and perform in code reviews and pull requests when needed.
Participate in functional testing of code, beta testing, and general quality assurance.
Provide detailed code comments, version control commits, and documentation pertaining to developed APIs/assets/code.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Perform all duties and maintain all standards in accordance with college policies, procedures and Core Values.

Required Qualifications:
Associate degree in graphic design, visual communications or user experience/user interface design from a regionally accredited institution and a minimum of three (3) years of experience with C++, C#, or JAVA and one or more of the following: Spring Framework, PostgreSQL, Docker, Apache Tomcat, SQL, Cloud based Server solutions (Azure, AWS, etc.). DevOps or deployment experience. Experience with Python, Nodejs and ExpressJS, Javascript frameworks such as React, Vue, or Angular, and usage of RESTful web APIs and services, preferred.

Equivalency Language:
An additional two (2) years of directly related experience may be substituted for the education requirement.
Preferred Qualifications/Experience:
A bachelor’s degree in web design or development or user experience/user interface design from a regionally accredited institution. AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure Certifications a plus. Experience working with Swift, React Native, Flutter, and the Android SDK, ARKit and ARCore, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence Development, Ruby on Rails or PHP, Unity or Unreal Engines, SAP Concur Travel Expense system, ASP VBscript, and Office 365 Enterprise Applications a plus.
Experience working in Higher Education preferred.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Knowledge of modern front- and back-end solutions for web-based projects, including, but not limited to, ES6, ES7, HTML5, CSS3, NodeJS, ReactJS, and server-side languages
Knowledge of software and web app development and deployment in a team setting
Knowledge of and ability to implement SAML for cross-domain single sign-on authentication
Knowledge in software solution implementation and current industry best practices
Computer and applicable software skills
Design oriented skills
Strong analytical skills
Organizational and time management skills
Effective oral and written technical communication skills
Interpersonal and customer service skills to provide effective assistance
Teamwork skills
Ability to communicate with faculty, staff, and students
Ability to provide advanced technical support
Ability to collaborate with others who may be located adjacently or remotely
Ability to review and understand code and procedures
Ability to recognize the value of new technologies and how they can benefit the college
Ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to stay current in software solution implementation and in industry best practices
Ability to work in a team environment
Physical Demands and Working Conditions:
Sedentary Work - Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally, a negligible amount of force frequently, and/or constantly having to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally and all other sedentary criteria are met. Positions in this class typically require talking, hearing, seeing, grasping, standing, walking and repetitive motions. Relatively free from unpleasant environmental conditions or hazards. Office environment. Little physical effort required.
***This is a Security Sensitive position. Candidates will be subject to a criminal background check.***

Employees may be requested to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description. Fair Labor Standards Act (exempt/non-exempt) is designated by position. The employer actively supports Americans with Disabilities Act and will consider reasonable accommodations.

Employment Type: Full-time Staff
Compensation Type: Annual
Compensation Range: $69,644.00 - 80,091.00

For any employment questions, please contact HR at (972) 985-3783 or email employment@collin.edu.

job_description:
Are you passionate about... building novel algorithms and systems to analyze and interpret the human genome ✧ working at the intersection of AI and healthcare ✧ solving hard computational problems that can enable progress in medicine and enhance our understanding of the biological world?
Join Dr. Popic’s research group at the Broad Institute and have fun solving 3-billion-piece puzzles every day! Our lab’s mission is to develop methods to unscramble the DNA sequence or mixture of sequences underlying the data we observe and figure out how variations in DNA sequences impact human genome diseases (such as, cancer) and responses to available treatments. We build solutions that focus on scalability, efficiency, and privacy - and involve combining new algorithmic problem formulations, with low-level system optimization, and biological insights about the problem domain. We design our tools to leverage the latest parallel computing platforms (such as the GPU and the cloud), as well as techniques from the fields of artificial intelligence, cryptography, and information theory.
As an Associate Computational Biologist, your main focus will be to develop and evaluate novel computational methods for the analysis and interpretation of large DNA datasets. You will work in close collaboration with your PI and fellow scientists at the Broad Institute, as well as researchers at the affiliated institutions, such as MIT and Harvard.
Responsibilities:
• Develop novel deep learning/machine learning algorithms for key computational problems in genomics
• Perform large-scale experiments for method evaluation and optimization
• Analyze a variety of large-scale DNA sequencing, graph, and image datasets
• Implement, test, ship, and maintain high-quality open-source software tools
• Communicate your research to the community via presentations and publications
Requirements:
• Bachelors and/or Masters degree in computer science, mathematics, or a related discipline.
• Experience in some of the following areas: machine learning, reinforcement learning, bioinformatics, biostatistics, graph theory, image processing, scientific computing, big data analytics
• Strong software engineering skills; Python and C/C++ preferred
• Familiarity with state-of-the-art deep learning frameworks is a plus
• Previous research experience is a big plus
#LI-DNP
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

job_description:
DISCO's growing services team is seeking a customer-focused Technical Support Associate. In this role, you will provide assistance to end-users throughout the legal discovery process, troubleshoot technical issues, and guide customers to use the DISCO platform optimally. You will also provide critical technical input to the Engineering team to diagnose and address platform issues and prioritize enhancements to the product.

What You'll Do

Use your technical skills to understand and address data file issues, identify and navigate network problems, and diagnose issues
Analyze client's needs, fully understand their requirements and determine the appropriate course of action
Proactively monitor open tickets, contact customers, and provide updates on a timely basis
Work with engineering, project managers and other groups within DISCO to resolve technical problems and/or client concerns
Work directly with customers advising them on how to best leverage DISCO in their day to day activities
Proactively contribute to improvements in documentation and our product
Help define business and technical requirements for improving the day to day activities of the department
Display professionalism, quality service and a "can do" attitude to internal members/departments of DISCO as well as external clients and vendors via written and verbal communication
Who You Are

1+ years experience in a technical support role at a technology company
Strong interest in technology with excellent problem-solving skills, with an initiative to research and craft creative technical solutions
Strong communication skills (written and verbal) in order to interact effectively with coworkers and clients.
Ability to communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical users
Passionate about providing a great customer experience and helping users
Strong attention to detail and organization skills
Ability to empathize with and advocate for our customers
Ability to quickly learn new concepts and teach others
Able to work at least one of the following shifts; M-F 7am – 3pm, M-F 10am – 6pm, or M-F 2pm – 10pm
Even Better If You Have...
Experience with any of the following; Salesforce, Jira, Asana, Talk Desk
BS in Technology or Business fields; or significant eDiscovery data processing experience in lieu of degree
Experience creating technical documentation
Prior litigation support or consulting experience
Why Technical Support at DISCO

Work at an exciting Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) startup that is rapidly growing and that is a disrupter in the legal space
Professional growth opportunities and opportunities for advancement
We use the latest customer service systems and workplace collaboration tools
Many high-profile clients offer a rewarding challenge for people who love to make clients happy
About DISCO

DISCO is a recognized leader in legal technology. Founded in 2012, DISCO's mission is to create great technology to modernize the practice of law. Our solutions apply artificial intelligence and cloud computing to help lawyers and legal teams improve legal outcomes for their clients. Corporate legal departments, law firms, and government agencies around the world use DISCO for ediscovery, case management, compliance, disputes, and investigations.

 DISCO has raised more than $135 million in venture capital and is using this investment to apply our unique combination of world-class engineering and deep legal expertise to build products that will transform the practice of law. We have an office in London and continue to expand our presence outside the United States.

Are you ready to revolutionize the practice of law? Join us!

Perks of DISCO
Open, inclusive, and fun environment
Benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, as well as 401(k)
Competitive salary plus stock options
Flexible PTO
Free catered lunches every day, as well as free snacks and beverages
Opportunity to be a part of a company that is revolutionizing the legal industry
Growth opportunities throughout the company


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job_description:
School of Medicine:
Established in 1930, Duke University School of Medicine is the youngest of the nation’s top medical schools. Ranked tenth among its peers, the School takes pride in being an inclusive community of outstanding learners, investigators, clinicians, and staff where traditional barriers are low, interdisciplinary collaboration is embraced, and great ideas accelerate translation of fundamental scientific discoveries to improve humanhealth locally and around the globe.

Comprised of 2,400 faculty physicians and researchers, the Duke University School of Medicine along with the Duke University School of Nursing and Duke University Health System create Duke Health . Duke Health is a world-class health care network. Founded in 1998 to provide efficient, responsive care, the health system offers a full network of health services and encompasses Duke University Hospital, Duke Regional Hospital, Duke Raleigh Hospital, Duke Primary Care, Private Diagnostic Clinic, Duke Home and Hospice, Duke Health and Wellness, and multiple affiliations.

AI Health Data Science Fellow
Job Code: 14 20, Associate in Research

Job Description

The Duke AI Health Data Science Fellowsh ip program is a 2-year training program for individuals with a strong qu antitative background seeking experience in data science with healthcare applications. The program is part of the broader AI Health Initiative, a key component of Duke University’s investment in data science as a tool to improve the lives of patients and solve problems that matter in he althcare.

The AI Health Data Science Fellowship program is structured to develop individuals early in their careers and provide th em with an intense but supportive environment to develop essential skill s in healthcare analytics and modern methods in artificial intelligence/ machine learning. Fellows will gain hands-on experience with cutting-edg e data science methods and healthcare data,while working on interdisciplinary teams to tackle projects that improve the lives of patients. Each team will include a quantitative lead, clinical lead,data engineer, the data science fellow, and students/trainees. The fellow will be mentored and work under the direction of the team’s quantitative lead, an individ ual with advanced expertise in data science and machine learning, to con tribute to meaningful, real-world applications guided by the clinical le ad(s). Each team will be embedded within a specific clinical area(e.g., cardiology,pediatrics, or psychiatry) allowing the team members to deve lop a broad understanding and familiarity with the clinical domain.

After their 2-year commitment, fellows can expect to be highly competitive for an array of opportunities in healthcare, academia, or i ndustry.

In addition to applying online, interested candid ates should send an email to plus-datascience@duke.edu with the subject line “AI Health Fellowship Inquiry”. Please include a cover letter and r esume.

Responsibilities

1. Develop data science and machine learning applications in health care (50%)
The Data Science Fellow will collaborate with their team to assess the big picture clinical question, translate the qu estion into an analyzable scope, and frame clear analytic objectives. Th e fellow will be responsible for all aspects of the analysis, as outline d below.

Tasks will include:

Developing an analytic plan that accurately reflects the clinical objectives and prope rly accounts for the population, available data (including the data gene rating mechanism), data quality and cleanliness, and potential for bias or confounding
Working either independently or with a dat a engineering team to define and create analytic data set(s)
Performing data exploration and descriptive analyses
Developing and evaluating appropriate statistical and machine learning m odels in a reproducible manner
Demonstrating comprehensio n of statistical and machine learning methods applied, including assumpt ions and limitations of a given approach

2. Develo p tools and generalizable infrastructure(20%)
The Data S cience Fellow will ensure the integrity of their results through good do cumentation and code provenance, carefully managing their code and devel oping accurate descriptions of what they are doing, and why, in a way th at others can understand. Fellows will demonstrate tool-specific skills and apply common software development practices such as modularizing cod e and using version control (e.g. , Git).

Tasks will inclu de:

Documenting project work with version control and reg ular project summary reports
Developing procedures, modul es, and programs to generalize code into reusable resources,within and a cross projects.
Preparing work for transition to implemen tation and product development teams.

3. Share and disseminate knowledge (20%)
The Data Science Fellow will engage and communicate with their team members, clinical sponsors, and leadership at varying levels of clinical and technical fluency. They wil l tailor their communications to the appropriate audience, including cli nical and quantitative team members, and demonstrate the ability to conv erse proficiently in many situations with diverse audiences.

Tasks will include:

Developing content including slide s,visualizations, and interactive tools.
Writing scientif ic content such as abstracts and manuscripts.
Preparing a nd delivering presentations.
Representing their team at m eetings, conferences, and external events.

4. Contribute t o the mission of AI Health (10%)
The Data Science Fellow will enga ge with their teams at a professional level and develop collegial relati onships. They will engage as an active contributor with their trans disc iplinary team, communicate clearly and regularly, bring issues forward, and work with the team to develop solutions.

Tasks will in clude:

With increasing levels of independence, mentoring students and trainees.
Participating in the development o f new opportunities.

Education/Training
Position requires a master’s degree in any quantitative discipline. Examples of quantitative disciplines include (but are not limited to) e ngineering, computer science, statistics, biostatistics, biomedical eng ineering, economics.

Skills/Experience

Demonstrated aptitude for data analysis, programming, and c reative problem solving.
Demonstrated proficiency in prog ramming, especially Python and R.
Experience in statistic al modeling is preferable but not required.
Experience wi th version control, databases, distributed computing, or cloud computing is preferable but not required.
Intellectual curiosity, as demonstrated by proactive pursuit of learning opportunities and diver se, challenging projects.
A passion for the application o f data science to solve important problems in healthcare and improving p atient lives.

Minimum Qualifications

Education
See job description for education requirements.
Experience
See job description for requirements.

Duke is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing employment opportunity without regard to an individual's age, color, disability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or veteran status.

Duke aspires to create a community built on collaboration, innovation, creativity, and belonging. Our collective success depends on the robust exchange of ideas—an exchange that is best when the rich diversity of our perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences flourishes. To achieve this exchange, it is essential that all members of the community feel secure and welcome, that the contributions of all individuals are respected, and that all voices are heard. All members of our community have a responsibility to uphold these values.

Essential Physical Job Functions: Certain jobs at Duke University and Duke University Health System may include essentialjob functions that require specific physical and/or mental abilities. Additional information and provision for requests for reasonable accommodation will be provided by each hiring department.

job_description: Position Summary:The Research Associate will conduct experiments involving immune cell based activity assays. The person will work closely with a Senior Scientist who will design the experiments. The Research Associate will be responsible for planning, conducting and troubleshooting experiments as well as collecting data, analyzing data, preparing technical reports and presenting the results to the R&D team. Position requires superb communication skills, ability to independently troubleshoot technical issues, ability to independently plan and execute experiments, ability to meet tight project timelines and ability to operate laboratory instrumentation and software.Key responsibilities:Maintain immune cells in tissue culture.Develop cell based assays.Process samples for ELISA assays.Collect and analyze data.Prepare reagents for experiments.Order and maintain lab supplies.Perform other duties as assigned.Education:BS in biological sciences and 3+ years laboratory experienceor MS and 1+ years laboratory experience.Experience:Proficiency with tissue culture and sterile technique is required.Experience with in vitro assay development is required.Proficiency in basic laboratory techniques is required.Proficiency with ELISA assays is required.Familiarity with immune cells is a plus.Experience in molecular biology is a plus.Data science and statistics knowledge is a plus.Programming experience (Python, Java, R) is a plus.About Koliber Biosciences:Koliber Biosciences is a start-up based in San Diego, CA working at the intersection of Artificial Intelligence and biology. Koliber provides data science services to biotech and pharma companies, which includes development of machine learning models as well as data analysis and visualization pipelines. The R&D efforts include development of advanced AI methods for drug lead optimization as well as validation of the model results in the wet lab. job_description:
Juris Doctor (JD) and admitted to at least one state bar (or equivalent)2+ years of legal experience

Amazon's Legal Department is looking for a talented attorney to support Amazon Web Services (AWS), a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon.com that is at the forefront of the cloud computing industry. AWS provides its customers with IT infrastructure services ranging from on-demand compute, storage, database, and network and content delivery, to artificial intelligence, mobile, internet of things, and more.

As Associate Corporate Counsel, AWS Products, you will partner with AWS service teams to develop, launch and support AWS services worldwide. You will serve as one of the primary lawyers responsible for counseling business teams on a broad range of product, commercial, technology, privacy, and regulatory matters, as well as structuring, drafting, and negotiating commercial transactions. You will work directly with the business, providing day-to-day advice, serving as lead counsel for strategic deals and relationships, and settling up structurual solutions that enable clients to achieve their business objectives as efficiently as possible. The role will include supporting AWS China operations and product development from Seattle, including cross-border coordination among AWS teams involved. The role will also provide support for other new product development (identifying legal risks and proposing mitigation strategies and negotiating strategic and technology licensing agreements) and operations. The role includes participating in other Amazon.com legal projects as directed, including managing legal issues that arise in existing commercial relationships and handling pre-litigation legal disputes and inquiries.

In-house experience at a technology companyExperience with cloud computing compliance and regulatory regimes
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. job_description:
Associate Software Integration Engineer I
Location: Salt Lake City, UT
The Associate Consultant I is a customer-facing, billable position chartered with engaging customers in a consultative capacity and providing specialized expertise around inContact products, the contact center industry, and other contact center ecosystem topics including CRM, telecommunications infrastructure, analytics, social media, and others. This position, depending on the types of projects onto which he or she is deployed, will be responsible for both technical and business tasks including managing customer expectations and satisfaction, configuring inContact products based on best practices and customer requirements, coordinating inter-departmental activities within inContact, tracking time and status within inContact systems, and other tasks related to the success of his or her engagement. The Associate Consultant is also an organizational leader and is expected to serve as a mentor and coach for junior staff.


This position is responsible for consultative performance in all areas related to inContact solutions provisioning, implementation, and deployment of technical and business solutions to clients. The customer base consists of public and private sector agencies and businesses employing diverse information management and contact center environments.

Major Functions/Responsibility

TECHNICAL

Provide Staff-level technical configuration and, in some cases, programming as required.
Provide process, data and object modeling in a variety of application and database environments.
Provide database design, development, and enhancement, as well as management and coordination of changes to existing applications.
Provide technical architecture leadership, analysis, design, development, and enhancement.
Maintain Staff-level expertise and currency in industry leading contact center technologies.
PROJECT

Serve in a project manager capacity via management of end to end system life cycle development of small to large-scale projects.
Develop costing proposals for projects, perform risk analysis, and manage change control.
Provide business analysis, business area assessment, user needs analysis and business systems design for major projects.
Conduct comprehensive cost/benefit analysis and prepare business cases for projects.
BUSINESS

Present a professional image in conduct, attitude and attire.
Assist with the development of client information management standards and evaluation of technology trends.
Contribute to business area assessment, user needs analysis and business systems design.
Assist with comprehensive cost/benefit analysis and preparation of business cases for new projects.

Required Education, Experience, and Specific Job Related Skills

Education Requirement:

BS/BA in technical (e.g., CS/IS/EE) or business (e.g., Marketing/MIS) field or equivalent work experience required.
Experience Requirement:

1+ years of professional experience beyond education requirements above. Type of experience varies depending on Consultant’s specialization:
Implementation & Solutions: broad skills in both technology & analysis
Business Optimization: deep skills around business analysis/call centers
Expert Services: deep skills in specialized technical & functional areas
Desired personal profile: analytical, inquisitive, service & team-oriented, friendly demeanor, early adopter.

Bonus Experience:

Prior consulting experience.
Computer Telephony Integration (CTI)
Administration of Windows Server and Desktop and/or Linux OS
Active Directory and DNS
Familiarity with project life cycles
Visio development
VMware knowledge
PCI/Security Networking and networking protocols: LAN, WAN, TCP/IP
Technical certification, e.g., MCSE, Cisco, Avaya
Microsoft SQL installation and queries including SSRS
C# knowledge

ABOUT NICE inContact: NICE inContact makes it easy and affordable for organizations around the globe to provide exceptional customer experiences while meeting key business metrics. NICE inContact provides the world’s #1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone™, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

job_description:
Company Description
Dcode was founded on the belief that technology can improve the way our government operates. Through our tech accelerators, training programs, and more we bring together a community of leaders across tech, government, industry, and venture capital to work together on solving some of government's most difficult problems.
Job Description
Our team is looking for a Program Associate support the execution of our accelerator programs.
This role will be best for exceptional candidates with 0-2 years of work experience who are interested in getting a front row seat to the intersection of tech and government, are extremely detail-oriented, have demonstrated success in past jobs or internships, and are excited to support operations and logistics in a fast-paced startup environment.
You'll fit right in if you bring a jet pack of motivation, strong organizational skills, an appetite for changing the world, and a track record of success.
As a Program Associate, you'll work to connect government with some of the world’s most innovative technologies as part of our accelerator program. For each program, you’ll help put together three months of intensive programming - this will include scheduling and invites, event management, putting together and proofing program content, and engaging directly with leaders in tech and government to help change the world.
Responsibilities
Provide logistical and programmatic support to our accelerator programs per year focused on bringing cutting edge technologies to the government.
Plan and execute high volume of events for each program to include 15+ curriculum sessions, hundreds of meetings across mentors, government, and industry, and happy hour/networking events.
Manage document creation, editing, and delivery of our accelerator curriculum on a weekly basis.
Schedule and track high volume meetings and event invitations as part of the program.
Track and report on program deliverables and progress.
Provide day-to-day support as part of a team working with 6-10 high growth venture backed startups in each program, supporting CEOs and sales leaders or some of the world’s leading tech companies.
Data entry.
We look for resilient hustlers: Our CEO busted her face on the balance beam in college and got back up… our CSO has knocked on a thousand doors… rejected 999 times and kept on knocking.
What is your story? Please provide a few short sentences on your resilient hustler story.
Qualifications
Key Skills
You’ll learn something new every day in this role. We’ll teach you the ropes but ideal candidates will have:
Enough technical chops to understand and work with everything from tomorrow’s cybersecurity tools to artificial intelligence innovators to small-sat companies without skipping a beat
An understanding of federal sales – how to speak acronym and navigate procurement as a startup with limited time and resources
Enough hustle and grind to own an entire program from soup to nuts – project/program management, client-facing experience, and event planning experience are all helpful
Ability to speak confidently in settings ranging from large group events to meetings with senior government, industry, and startup leaders
Core Competencies
Strong organization, self-management, and people skills.
Efficient, results oriented, resilient, and flexible and goal oriented.
Time management.
Excellent team communication skills.
Come with your own “jet pack” of motivation and drive.
Proven problem-solving abilities.
Extremely effective at client facing interaction.
Prior experience and/or strong interest in technology, startups, or government.
Ability to consistently produce exceptional results with limited resources.
Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Dcode believes in diversity as strength. We provide equal opportunity to all persons without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, marital status, or other. We proudly uphold a zero tolerance policy.

Key Skills.  Enough hustle and grind to own an entire program from soup to nuts – project/program management, client-facing experience, and event planning experience are all helpful. job_description:
Job Description
We are searching for a talented Systems Engineer to join our Unity3d game engine based application development team. You would be working on installing, testing, integrating, and operating our RAVE simulation software (Real-time Automated Virtual Environment) which is used by the Navy and DoD partners during training events.
RAVE is one piece of software in a collection of products that Alion develops for the Navy Training Baseline (NTB). You would be joining a small but expanding group of talented and passionate developers on the RAVE team.
Duties:
As a System Engineer you would be responsible for:
installing the system on high-end hardware
ensuring the system function functions as expected
integrating the system with other tools
operating the system as a technical user
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related discipline plus 3 to 4 years of directly related experience is required; 4-5 years game development experience highly preferred
In some cases, educational requirements may be adjusted or waived for applicable work experience. Work experience may be adjusted for highly specialized knowledge or uniquely applicable experience

Must have (or be able to obtain) Security+ and Linux+ certifications

Should possess a thorough understanding of Linux and Windows operating systems and be able to use advanced capabilities of these systems.

Knowledge of networks and networking concepts; ability to utilize network and distributed modeling & simulation tools such as Wireshark.

Familiarization with Object Oriented Design (OOD) concepts and techniques.

Familiarization with Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning concepts is a plus

Ability to analyze and troubleshoot distributed simulation problems and provide acceptable solutions or corrections.
Ability to provide technical project leadership, establish milestones, estimate resources, and other project management skills.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Clearance:
Must be a US Citizen able to obtain a Secret security clearance.CJ
Security Clearance: Secret

job_description:
OPPORTUNITY OVERVIEW
ZeroFOX seeks an Associate Threat Analyst (ATA) to author, contextualize, and deliver OSINT reporting to our largest and most complex customers. The selected candidate will be the primary analyst contact and aligned resource to dedicated customer(s). The goal of this role is to exceed client expectations and drive value through creation and delivery of meaningful reporting, ongoing education, and being the internal ZeroFOX advocate for your customer(s) needs. This is a high-profile position reporting within ZeroFOX’s Global Operations organization.

The Associate Threat Analyst should not be afraid to roll up their sleeves and help analysts, perform deep dive analyses of threats, manage escalation response and recommendations, and contextualize alerts. The ATA will be asked to think like an ATA will be asked to think like a true "purple" team member - understanding the red and blue team aspects of issues and responding to real world incidents impacting our dedicated customer(s). ATAs provide value-driven risk analysis to ensure their dedicated customer(s) understand and mitigate risk. This role requires a team player who relishes the opportunity to shape a growing function and is a self-starter. This is the perfect job for those who like solving complex problems with multiple internal and external stakeholders, pushing the boundaries of what current technology and analytics provide, and aren’t afraid to own the challenges these present. Candidates with prior experience in OSINT Research and/or Financial Fraud Investigations will be given priority consideration. To be clear, this job enables the candidate to grow and thrive in a fast moving SOC environment while learning, developing and exceeding Customer Experience goals

Scope of Responsibility
Manage research projects that involve multiple stakeholders
Independently assess and manage complex issues
Manage customer requirements and questions to shape positive outcomes
Manage the risk reporting process and delivery for dedicated customer(s)
Collect and compile complex data from various sources, making appropriate correlation of collected data to build upon an understanding of threat activity and communicate the impact to customers
Maintain current functional and technical knowledge of ZeroFOX service options
Provide advice and guidance as the subject matter expert to ensure successful ongoing usage and value from the ZeroFOX platform configuration
Initiate engagement with other ZeroFOX resources when needed as a customer advocate to ensure speedy resolution of customer issues
Engage with ZeroFOX internal organizations including Product, Sales, Global Operations, etc. as the customer advocate on product roadmap discussions and ongoing service needs
Requirements
Successful track history working autonomously in an intelligence, consulting, cybersecurity, or analyst role, typically obtained in 2+ years
Experience using data and trend analysis, graph analysis, and OSINT research tools
Knowledge of major social networks (knowledge of emerging networks a big plus), and desire to learn about Deep & Dark Web tactics, Phishing analysis, and malware analysis
Ability to talk to different levels of customer from analyst to C-Level
Ability to speak to technical experts as well as the layman about technical and analytic subject matter
Ability to think critically about subjects and a comfort with analysis without full information
Basic understanding of cyber security, intelligence, or national security threats
Outstanding research and writing skills with emphasis on oral presentations and translating complex concepts into easily digestible pieces across all organizational levels. A writing sample will be requested as part of the interview process
Exceptional interpersonal and social skills
Experience with SaaS-based platform configuration and maintenance for enterprise organizations
Direct customer advocacy and engagement experience in post-sales or professional services functions in Fortune 1000, mid-tier, and/or start-up companies
Excellent analytical skills & problem-solving skills, combined with the ability to provide quick resolution to problems
History of execution via teamwork, collaboration, adaptability & initiative
Big Bonuses
Knowledge of cyber threats facing large enterprises and other organizations.
Previous experience extrapolating trends from mass amounts of disparate data.
Previous experience working in an analyst role, particularly working with data analytics, dashboards, and reporting
Experience with other SaaS, cyber security, intelligence, consulting, or social media products or services.
Bachelor’s or Graduate degree in Cybersecurity, humanities, or other similar background
Skill with various workflow tools: JIRA, SQL, SalesForce, Google Apps, Zendesk
Propensity to thrive on change and general dissatisfaction with the “status quo” founded on the belief that great is better than good
Past experience working in customer success, technical support, configuration and / or training capacity
Do you want to love where you work?
Amazing Product: ZeroFOX is creating paradigm shifting cyber security product
Bragging Rights: The Forrester New Wave(™): Digital Risk Protection, Q3 2018, named ZeroFOX a Leader after a thorough evaluation of the top 14 vendors. Learn why Forrester says “ZeroFOX leads the pack in social media protection and digital risk analytics” and describes ZeroFOX as the “best for those that want actionable intelligence and rapid remediation.
Awesome Culture: ZeroFOX is a community – most describe our team as a group of close-knit, incredibly talented, and highly caffeinated people. Behind ZeroFOX’s numerous accolades lies a vibrant ecosystem where team members have fun and are rewarded for continual innovation, disruption, and taking ownership in their work.
Get Things Done: Innovation is woven into the fabric of our organization. Every aspect of our operations is purposeful; enabling us to research, develop and innovate faster than the competition.
Benefits: In addition to competitive compensation, full-time employees can participate in our health insurance plans, retirement, and more.
Best Office in Downtown Baltimore (Federal Hill): Large floor-to-ceiling windows, a productive workspace, an awesome community area and free street parking available.
Interested?
Ready to apply? Visit us at https://www.zerofox.com/careers to find out more and join the best team in the security industry.
Not ready to apply? Email careers_at_zerofox_dot_com to speak with a member of the team!
ABOUT ZEROFOX
ZeroFOX, the market leader in digital visibility and protection, safeguards modern organizations from dynamic security, brand and physical risks across social, mobile, web and collaboration platforms. Using diverse data sources and artificial intelligence-based analysis, the ZeroFOX Platform identifies and remediates targeted phishing attacks, credential compromise, data exfiltration, brand hijacking, executive and location threats and more. The patented ZeroFOX SaaS technology processes and protects millions of posts, messages and accounts daily across the social and digital landscape, spanning LinkedIn, Facebook, Slack, Twitter, Instagram, Pastebin, YouTube, mobile app stores, the deep & dark web, domains and more.

**ZeroFOX is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in e-Verify**
